The eighth season of _[The Walking Dead](/wiki/The_Walking_Dead_\(TV_series\)
"The Walking Dead \(TV series\)")_ , an American [post-
apocalyptic](/wiki/Apocalyptic_and_post-apocalyptic_fiction "Apocalyptic and
post-apocalyptic fiction") [horror](/wiki/Horror_fiction "Horror fiction")
[television series](/wiki/Television_series "Television series") on
[AMC](/wiki/AMC_\(TV_channel\) "AMC \(TV channel\)"), premiered on October 22,
2017,[1] and will consist of 16 episodes[2] split into two eight-episode
parts, with the second part debuting on February 25, 2018.[3]

Developed for television by [Frank Darabont](/wiki/Frank_Darabont "Frank
Darabont"), the series is based on the [eponymous series of comic
books](/wiki/The_Walking_Dead_\(comic_book\) "The Walking Dead \(comic
book\)") by [Robert Kirkman](/wiki/Robert_Kirkman "Robert Kirkman"), [Tony
Moore](/wiki/Tony_Moore_\(artist\) "Tony Moore \(artist\)"), and [Charlie
Adlard](/wiki/Charlie_Adlard "Charlie Adlard"). The executive producers are
Kirkman, David Alpert, [Scott M. Gimple](/wiki/Scott_M._Gimple "Scott M.
Gimple"), [Greg Nicotero](/wiki/Greg_Nicotero "Greg Nicotero"), [Tom
Luse](/wiki/Tom_Luse "Tom Luse"), and [Gale Anne Hurd](/wiki/Gale_Anne_Hurd
"Gale Anne Hurd"), with Gimple as [showrunner](/wiki/Showrunner "Showrunner")
for the fifth consecutive season. The eighth season has received mostly
positive reviews.

This season adapts the "All Out War" story arc from the comics, with the
survivors of the Alexandria Safe-Zone, the Hilltop, the Kingdom, and later the
Scavengers taking on [Negan](/wiki/Negan "Negan") ([Jeffrey Dean
Morgan](/wiki/Jeffrey_Dean_Morgan "Jeffrey Dean Morgan")) and the Saviors.[4]

### Main
cast[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_8\)&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: Main cast")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/8/8c/Walking_Dead_Season_8_SDCC.jpg/400px-
Walking_Dead_Season_8_SDCC.jpg)](/wiki/File:Walking_Dead_Season_8_SDCC.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Walking_Dead_Season_8_SDCC.jpg "Enlarge")

The primary characters of the eighth season include (from left to right):
[Rick](/wiki/Rick_Grimes "Rick Grimes"), [Carol](/wiki/Carol_Peletier "Carol
Peletier"), [Morgan](/wiki/Morgan_Jones_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Morgan Jones
\(The Walking Dead\)"), [Daryl](/wiki/Daryl_Dixon "Daryl Dixon"),
[Carl](/wiki/Carl_Grimes "Carl Grimes"), Enid, [Rosita](/wiki/Rosita_Espinosa
"Rosita Espinosa"), [Tara](/wiki/Tara_Chambler "Tara Chambler"),
[Michonne](/wiki/Michonne "Michonne"),
[Gabriel](/wiki/Gabriel_Stokes_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Gabriel Stokes \(The
Walking Dead\)"), [Aaron](/wiki/Aaron_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Aaron \(The
Walking Dead\)"), [Maggie](/wiki/Maggie_Greene "Maggie Greene"),
[Jesus](/wiki/Paul_%22Jesus%22_Monroe "Paul "Jesus" Monroe"),
[Gregory](/wiki/Gregory_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Gregory \(The Walking Dead\)"),
Shiva, [Ezekiel](/wiki/King_Ezekiel "King Ezekiel"), Jadis,
[Eugene](/wiki/Eugene_Porter "Eugene Porter"), Simon,
[Dwight](/wiki/Dwight_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Dwight \(The Walking Dead\)"), and
[Negan](/wiki/Negan "Negan")

The eighth season features twenty series regulars overall. For this season,
[Katelyn Nacon](/wiki/Katelyn_Nacon "Katelyn Nacon"), [Khary
Payton](/wiki/Khary_Payton "Khary Payton"), [Steven Ogg](/wiki/Steven_Ogg
"Steven Ogg"), and [Pollyanna McIntosh](/wiki/Pollyanna_McIntosh "Pollyanna
McIntosh") were promoted to series regular status, after previously having
recurring roles, while [Seth Gilliam](/wiki/Seth_Gilliam "Seth Gilliam") and
[Ross Marquand](/wiki/Ross_Marquand "Ross Marquand") were added to the opening
credits.

####
Starring[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_8\)&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Starring")]

  * [Andrew Lincoln](/wiki/Andrew_Lincoln "Andrew Lincoln") as [Rick Grimes](/wiki/Rick_Grimes "Rick Grimes"), the series' [protagonist](/wiki/Protagonist "Protagonist"), a former sheriff and the leader of Alexandria, who is leading a new alliance to fight Negan and the Saviors.
  * [Norman Reedus](/wiki/Norman_Reedus "Norman Reedus") as [Daryl Dixon](/wiki/Daryl_Dixon "Daryl Dixon"), Rick's right-hand man, the group's primary hunter and a recruiter for Alexandria.
  * [Lauren Cohan](/wiki/Lauren_Cohan "Lauren Cohan") as [Maggie Rhee](/wiki/Maggie_Greene "Maggie Greene"), the pregnant widow of [Glenn](/wiki/Glenn_Rhee "Glenn Rhee") and a leading figure of the Hilltop.
  * [Chandler Riggs](/wiki/Chandler_Riggs "Chandler Riggs") as [Carl Grimes](/wiki/Carl_Grimes "Carl Grimes"), Rick's bold and courageous teenage son.
  * [Danai Gurira](/wiki/Danai_Gurira "Danai Gurira") as [Michonne](/wiki/Michonne "Michonne"), Rick's katana-wielding girlfriend, who acts as a mother figure to Carl and Judith.
  * [Melissa McBride](/wiki/Melissa_McBride "Melissa McBride") as [Carol Peletier](/wiki/Carol_Peletier "Carol Peletier"), a fierce survivor who is spurred into fighting the Saviors as revenge for the deaths of her friends.
  * [Lennie James](/wiki/Lennie_James "Lennie James") as [Morgan Jones](/wiki/Morgan_Jones_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Morgan Jones \(The Walking Dead\)"), the first survivor Rick had ever encountered, who now resides in the Kingdom and fights for his sanity.
  * [Alanna Masterson](/wiki/Alanna_Masterson "Alanna Masterson") as [Tara Chambler](/wiki/Tara_Chambler "Tara Chambler"), a caring, witty member of the group and supply runner for Alexandria who serves as a liaison with Oceanside.
  * [Josh McDermitt](/wiki/Josh_McDermitt "Josh McDermitt") as [Eugene Porter](/wiki/Eugene_Porter "Eugene Porter"), a timorous former member of the group whose resourcefulness leads Negan to take him under his wing.
  * [Christian Serratos](/wiki/Christian_Serratos "Christian Serratos") as [Rosita Espinosa](/wiki/Rosita_Espinosa "Rosita Espinosa"), an impulsive member of the group, who is motivated to avenge her ex-boyfriend Spencer and Abraham's death.
  * [Seth Gilliam](/wiki/Seth_Gilliam "Seth Gilliam") as [Gabriel Stokes](/wiki/Gabriel_Stokes_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Gabriel Stokes \(The Walking Dead\)"), a priest who has become hardened from his experiences with Rick's group.
  * [Ross Marquand](/wiki/Ross_Marquand "Ross Marquand") as [Aaron](/wiki/Aaron_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Aaron \(The Walking Dead\)"), an Alexandrian recruiter who brought Rick's group to Alexandria and is currently in the fight against the Saviors.
  * [Jeffrey Dean Morgan](/wiki/Jeffrey_Dean_Morgan "Jeffrey Dean Morgan") as [Negan](/wiki/Negan "Negan"), the sociopathic and charismatic leader of the Saviors who serves as the season's primary antagonist.

#### Also
starring[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_8\)&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Also starring")]

  * [Austin Amelio](/wiki/Austin_Amelio "Austin Amelio") as [Dwight](/wiki/Dwight_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Dwight \(The Walking Dead\)"), a former subordinate of Negan who now works for Rick as a double agent against the Saviors.
  * [Tom Payne](/wiki/Tom_Payne_\(actor\) "Tom Payne \(actor\)") as [Paul "Jesus" Rovia](/wiki/Paul_%22Jesus%22_Monroe "Paul "Jesus" Monroe"), a scout for the Hilltop.
  * [Xander Berkeley](/wiki/Xander_Berkeley "Xander Berkeley") as [Gregory](/wiki/Gregory_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Gregory \(The Walking Dead\)"), the selfish and hypocritical leader of the Hilltop whose influence diminished with Maggie's prominence.
  * [Khary Payton](/wiki/Khary_Payton "Khary Payton") as [King Ezekiel](/wiki/King_Ezekiel "King Ezekiel"), the charismatic leader of the Kingdom who allies with Rick against the Saviors.
  * [Steven Ogg](/wiki/Steven_Ogg "Steven Ogg") as Simon, a former mortgage broker and Negan's ruthless second-in-command.[5]
  * [Katelyn Nacon](/wiki/Katelyn_Nacon "Katelyn Nacon") as Enid, a former member of Alexandria who moved to Hilltop to be with Maggie, and has formed a relationship with Carl.[5]
  * [Pollyanna McIntosh](/wiki/Pollyanna_McIntosh "Pollyanna McIntosh") as Jadis, the deceptive leader of the Scavengers who betrayed Rick's group, and maintains a neutral stance in the war.[5]

##
Production[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_8\)&action=edit&section=13
"Edit section: Production")]

_The Walking Dead_ was renewed by AMC for a 16-episode eighth season on
October 16, 2016,[2] and that same month it was reported that [Maria
Bello](/wiki/Maria_Bello "Maria Bello") would have a role on the show.[6]
Production began on April 25, 2017, in [Atlanta,
Georgia](/wiki/Atlanta,_Georgia "Atlanta, Georgia").[7] On July 12, 2017,
production was shut down after stuntman [John Bernecker](/wiki/John_Bernecker
"John Bernecker") was killed, after falling more than 20 feet onto a concrete
floor.[8] Production resumed on July 17.[9]

The season premiere, which also serves as the series' milestone [100th
episode](/wiki/100_episodes "100 episodes"), was directed by executive
producer [Greg Nicotero](/wiki/Greg_Nicotero "Greg Nicotero").[10]

In November 2017, it was announced that [Lennie James](/wiki/Lennie_James
"Lennie James") who portrays [Morgan
Jones](/wiki/Morgan_Jones_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Morgan Jones \(The Walking
Dead\)"), would be leaving _The Walking Dead_ after the conclusion of this
season, and he will join the cast of the spin-off series _[Fear the Walking
Dead](/wiki/Fear_the_Walking_Dead "Fear the Walking Dead")_.[11]

##
Episodes[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_8\)&action=edit&section=14
"Edit section: Episodes")]

See also: [List of The Walking Dead
episodes](/wiki/List_of_The_Walking_Dead_episodes "List of The Walking Dead
episodes")

No.  
overall | No. in  
season | Title | Directed by | Written by | Original air date | U.S. viewers  
(millions)  
---|---|---|---|---|---|---  
100 | 1 | "[Mercy](/wiki/Mercy_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Mercy \(The Walking Dead\)")" | [Greg Nicotero](/wiki/Greg_Nicotero "Greg Nicotero") | [Scott M. Gimple](/wiki/Scott_M._Gimple "Scott M. Gimple") | October 22, 2017 (2017-10-22) | 11.44[12]  
Rick, Maggie, and Ezekiel rally their communities together to take down Negan.
Gregory attempts to have the Hilltop residents side with Negan, but they all
firmly stand behind Maggie. The group attacks the Sanctuary, taking down its
fences and flooding the compound with walkers. With the Sanctuary defaced,
everyone leaves except Gabriel, who reluctantly stays to save Gregory, but is
left behind when Gregory abandons him. Surrounded by walkers, Gabriel hides in
a trailer, where he is trapped inside with Negan.  
101 | 2 | "[The Damned](/wiki/The_Damned_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "The Damned \(The Walking Dead\)")" | [Rosemary Rodriguez](/wiki/Rosemary_Rodriguez "Rosemary Rodriguez") | Matthew Negrete & Channing Powell | October 29, 2017 (2017-10-29) | 8.92[13]  
Rick's forces split into separate parties to attack several of the Saviors'
outposts, during which many members of the group are killed; Eric is
critically injured and rushed away by Aaron. Jesus stops Tara and Morgan from
executing a group of surrendered Saviors. While clearing an outpost with
Daryl, Rick is confronted and held at gunpoint by Morales, a survivor he met
in the initial Atlanta camp, who is now with the Saviors.  
102 | 3 | "[Monsters](/wiki/Monsters_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Monsters \(The Walking Dead\)")" | Greg Nicotero | Matthew Negrete & Channing Powell | November 5, 2017 (2017-11-05) | 8.52[14]  
Daryl finds Morales threatening Rick and kills him; the duo then pursue a
group of Saviors who are transporting weapons to another outpost. Gregory
returns to Hilltop, and after a heated argument, Maggie ultimately allows him
back in the community. Eric dies from his injuries, leaving Aaron distraught.
Despite Tara and Morgan's objections, Jesus leads the group of surrendered
Saviors to Hilltop. Ezekiel's group attacks another Savior compound, during
which several Kingdommers are shot while protecting Ezekiel.  
103 | 4 | "[Some Guy](/wiki/Some_Guy_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Some Guy \(The Walking Dead\)")" | Dan Liu | [David Leslie Johnson](/wiki/David_Leslie_Johnson "David Leslie Johnson") | November 12, 2017 (2017-11-12) | 8.69[15]  
Ezekiel's group is overwhelmed by the Saviors, who kill all of them except for
Ezekiel himself and Jerry. Carol clears the inside of the compound, killing
all but two Saviors, who almost escape but are eventually caught by Rick and
Daryl. En route to the Kingdom, Ezekiel, Jerry, and Carol are surrounded by
walkers, but Shiva sacrifices herself to save them. The trio returns to the
Kingdom, where Ezekiel's confidence in himself as a leader has diminished.  
104 | 5 | "[The Big Scary U](/wiki/The_Big_Scary_U "The Big Scary U")" | Michael E. Satrazemis | _Story by_ : Scott M. Gimple & David Leslie Johnson & [Angela Kang](/wiki/Angela_Kang "Angela Kang")  
_Teleplay by_ : David Leslie Johnson & Angela Kang | November 19, 2017 (2017-11-19) | 7.85[16]  
After confessing their sins to each other, Gabriel and Negan manage to escape
from the trailer. Simon and the other lieutenants grow suspicious of each
other, knowing that Rick’s forces must have inside information. The workers in
the Sanctuary become increasingly frustrated with their living conditions, and
a riot nearly ensues, until Negan returns and restores order. Gabriel is
locked in a cell, where Eugene discovers him sick and suffering. Meanwhile,
Rick and Daryl argue over how to take out the Saviors, leading Daryl to
abandon Rick.  
105 | 6 | "[The King, the Widow, and Rick](/wiki/The_King,_the_Widow,_and_Rick "The King, the Widow, and Rick")" | [John Polson](/wiki/John_Polson "John Polson") | Angela Kang & Corey Reed | November 26, 2017 (2017-11-26) | 8.28[17]  
Rick visits Jadis in hopes of convincing her to turn against Negan; Jadis
refuses, and locks Rick in a shipping container. Carl encounters Siddiq in the
woods and recruits him to Alexandria. Daryl and Tara plot to deviate from
Rick’s plans by destroying the Sanctuary. Ezekiel isolates himself at the
Kingdom, where Carol tries to encourage him to be the leader his people need.
Maggie has the group of captured Saviors placed in a holding area and forces
Gregory to join them as punishment for betraying Hilltop.  
106 | 7 | "[Time for After](/wiki/Time_for_After "Time for After")" | [Larry Teng](/wiki/Larry_Teng "Larry Teng") | Matthew Negrete & Corey Reed | December 3, 2017 (2017-12-03) | 7.47[18]  
After learning of Dwight's association with Rick's group, Eugene affirms his
loyalty to Negan and outlines a plan to get rid of the walkers surrounding the
Sanctuary. With help from Morgan and Tara, Daryl drives a truck through the
Sanctuary’s walls, flooding its interior with walkers, killing many Saviors.
Rick finally convinces Jadis and the Scavengers to align with him, and they
plan to force the Saviors to surrender. However, when they arrive at the
Sanctuary, Rick is horrified to see the breached walls and no sign of the
walker herd.  
107 | 8 | "[How It's Gotta Be](/wiki/How_It%27s_Gotta_Be "How It's Gotta Be")" | Michael E. Satrazemis | David Leslie Johnson & Angela Kang | December 10, 2017 (2017-12-10) | 7.89[19]  
Eugene's plan allows the Saviors to escape, and separately, the Saviors waylay
the Alexandria, Hilltop, and Kingdom forces. The Scavengers abandon Rick,
after which he returns to Alexandria. Ezekiel ensures that the Kingdom
residents are able to escape before locking himself in the community with the
Saviors. Eugene aids Gabriel and Doctor Carson in escaping the Sanctuary in
order to ease his conscience. Negan attacks Alexandria, but Carl devises a
plan to allow the Alexandria residents to escape into the sewers. Carl reveals
he was bitten by a walker while escorting Siddiq to Alexandria.  
108 | 9 | "[Honor](/wiki/Honor_\(The_Walking_Dead\) "Honor \(The Walking Dead\)")" | Greg Nicotero | Matthew Negrete & Channing Powell | February 25, 2018 (2018-02-25) | 8.28[20]  
After the Saviors leave Alexandria, the survivors make for the Hilltop while
Rick and Michonne stay behind to say their final goodbyes to a dying Carl, who
pleads with Rick to build a better future alongside the Saviors before killing
himself. In the Kingdom, Morgan and Carol launch a rescue mission for Ezekiel.
Although they are successful and retake the Kingdom, the Saviors' lieutenant
Gavin is killed by Benjamin's vengeful brother Henry.  
109 | 10 | "The Lost and the Plunderers"[21] | TBA | TBA | March 4, 2018 (2018-03-04) | TBD  
110 | 11 | "Dead or Alive Or"[21] | TBA | TBA | March 11, 2018 (2018-03-11) | TBD  
111 | 12 | "The Key"[21] | TBA | TBA | March 18, 2018 (2018-03-18) | TBD  
  
##
Release[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_8\)&action=edit&section=15
"Edit section: Release")]

The first trailer for the season was released on July 21, 2017, at [San Diego
Comic-Con](/wiki/San_Diego_Comic-Con "San Diego Comic-Con"). The second
trailer was released on February 1, 2018, for the second part of the
season.[22]

##
Reception[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_8\)&action=edit&section=16
"Edit section: Reception")]

### Critical
response[[edit](/w/index.php?title=The_Walking_Dead_\(season_8\)&action=edit&section=17
"Edit section: Critical response")]

The eighth season of _The Walking Dead_ has received mostly positive reviews
from critics. On [Rotten Tomatoes](/wiki/Rotten_Tomatoes "Rotten Tomatoes"),
the season holds a score of 73% with an [average
rating](/wiki/Weighted_arithmetic_mean "Weighted arithmetic mean") of 6.9 out
of 10, based on 13 reviews, and an average episode score of 69%. The site's
critical consensus reads: "_The Walking Dead_ 's eighth season energizes its
characters with some much-needed angst and action, though it's still
occasionally choppy and lacking forward-moving plot progression."[23]
